column2: MONTANA DMV TEST
Question Text
1. To practice defensive driving you should:
column4: look well ahead of your vehicle and be aware of developing traffic situations around you.
column8: always leave yourself a way out.

column2: 2. To drive more safely at night:
column4: don’t drive when you are tired.
column6: make sure your headlights are working properly.

column2: 3. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column6: turning right on red is forbidden.
column8: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.

column2: 4. Drugs may interfere with a person’s ability to drive safely:
column8: even if they are prescribed by a doctor.
column10: unless they are prescribed by a doctor.

column2: 5. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
column6: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 6. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column6: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 7. On a road with two or more lanes in the same direction, you approach an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its warning lights on. You must:
column4: maintain your current speed and stay in your lane.
column6: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column8: pass the emergency vehicle as quickly as possible.
column10: slow down. If possible, change lanes.

column2: 8. ___________ are the most frequent fatality in work zone crashes.
9. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 10. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
11. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column6: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.
column8: only if the traffic signal turns red.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
13. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column10: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
15. Green and white signs:
column4: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column6: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column10: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 16. This sign means:
column8: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 17. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 18. Drinking alcoholic beverages:
column4: gives you a feeling of false confidence.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column6: Don’t park next to the traffic signal
column10: The traffic signal ahead is out of order

column2: 20. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column6: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column8: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column10: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
22. This sign means:
column4: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column6: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column10: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column6: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column2: 24. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
25. This road sign means:
column8: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 26. BAC is expressed in:
column6: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 27. Drivers should always look carefully for motorcycles before changing lanes because:
column4: motorcycles always have the right-of-way at intersections.
column6: motorcycles are smaller and harder to see.
column8: motorcycles are not permitted to share traffic lanes.

column2: 28. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column4: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 29. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column6: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
31. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 32. What does this road sign indicate?
column10: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 33. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column6: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 31. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 32. What does this road sign indicate?
column10: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 33. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column6: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
